result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to: DE.   Check #: 033583     arc    Mailed this  date

*Amended*  
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.A. with the exception of by phone for the purpose of communication regarding the children and parenting time. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

9:24 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dan Firkus in court w/defendant Michael Charles Cochies Knight. Atty Firkus asks to amend bond to NAC as to A.A. and remove the NC with A.I.M, Z.I.M, A.M. F.I.M, or N.I.M.  Atty Ballo states victims requests. Atty Firkus responds. DE enters NG pleas on the Misdemeanors. Attys to file all pretrial submissions no later than 11/7. Court will send out scheduling order. DE may request another BBH if provides proof of D/V assessment. Adjourned: 9:35 am
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.A., or their children A.I.M., Z.I.M., A.M., F.I.M., or N.I.M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:25 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Michael Charles Cochies Knight appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. Court orders bond- cash posted to be returned to payor. Court may consider modification of bond if DE completes DV assessment. Court sets BBH. QUASH WARRANT. gll
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
